pages.text: Suminia getmanovi was an anomodont synapsid that lived during the Late Permian in what is now the Kirov region of Russia. This small herbivore was a tree-climber, complete with a first digit that worked like an opposable thumb, allowing it to grasp, cling, and hook onto things. The tail is also thought to have been prehensile enough to grasp branches.
